author: yperbasis
content: <@199561711278227457> pectra-devnet-4 spec says "included in devnet-3" and points to an old version of 7251

author: parithosh
content: ah let me update to a newer commit, sorry about that!

author: parithosh
content:
Updates to devnet-4 spec:
- Updated EIP commit
- Some updates from Felix/Mikhail, i.e, change request to flat encoding has been merged

There are still a bunch of Open PRs, if something needs sync discussion please flag it before the testing call today: 
https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/pectra-devnet-4#Open-PRs

author: tersec
content:
two main concerns:
- will there be a consensus spec test suite release which corresponds to this? (not, oh, most of it but these three EIPs are slightly different)
- will either the 6110 finalization/non-forking PR be part of this, or forked validator indices won't be tested? at this point it's sort of pointless for Nimbus to implement them when they should go in imminently

author: tersec
content: for EL EIPs obviously point 1 isn't salient

author: parithosh
content:
Yeah ideally we'd have both a EL and CL spec release that we can pin to. The open PRs are the bit that need immediate attention to resolve. 

could you point me to the 6110 PR you referenced?

author: tersec
content: > eip6110: Queue deposit requests and apply them during epoch processing

author: parithosh
content: they should go in, since the there are just two PRs left in the consensus specs, once they're in we should be able to co-ordinate a release

author: jtraglia
content: Yes, we're planning on merging those & making a release this week.
